title: Ebrahima Sawaneh
text:
Ebrahima 'Ibou' Sawaneh (born 7 September 1986) is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> striker from <a href="The%20Gambia">The Gambia</a> who is currently playing for <a href="K.S.C.%20City%20Pirates">City Pirates</a> in the <a href="Belgian%20Division%202">Belgian Division 2</a>. In the past he played for various clubs, including <a href="Lech%20Poznan">Lech Poznan</a>, <a href="KSK%20Beveren">KSK Beveren</a>, <a href="KV%20Kortrijk">KV Kortrijk</a>, <a href="KV%20Mechelen">KV Mechelen</a>, <a href="RAEC%20Mons">RAEC Mons</a>, <a href="Oud-Heverlee%20Leuven">OH Leuven</a> and <a href="Muaither%20SC">Muaither</a>.
Ebrahima Sawaneh has a double nationality (Gambian-German), but makes his appearance for the <a href="Gambia%20national%20football%20team">Gambia national football team</a>.
Career.
On 3 February 2014 Ibou Sawaneh returned to his parent club <a href="Oud-Heverlee%20Leuven">OH Leuven</a> after a four-month loan spell in Qatar at <a href="Muaither%20SC">Muaither SC</a>.
In January 2019, Ibou joined <a href="Union%20Titus%20P%C3%A9tange">Titus Pétange</a> in Luxembourg on a half-year contract. He left the club at the end of his contract in July 2019, having played 13 league games and scored 7 goals.
